001package io.jstach.rainbowgum.output;
002
003import java.io.File;
004import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
005import java.io.FileOutputStream;
006import java.io.IOException;
007import java.io.OutputStream;
008import java.io.UncheckedIOException;
009import java.net.URI;
010import java.nio.ByteBuffer;
011import java.nio.channels.FileChannel;
012import java.nio.channels.FileLock;
013
014import org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable;
015
016import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogEvent;
017import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogOutput;
018import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties;
019import io.jstach.rainbowgum.MetaLog;
020import io.jstach.rainbowgum.annotation.LogConfigurable;
021
022/**
023 * An output that is designed for writing to a file.
024 */
025public interface FileOutput extends LogOutput {
026
027        @Override
028        default OutputType type() {
029                return OutputType.FILE;
030        }
031
032        /**
033         * Creates file output.
034         * @param name name of output not file name.
035         * @param uri file uri.
036         * @param fileName file name.
037         * @param append whether or not to append to existing file.
038         * @param prudent logback prudent mode where files are locked on each write.
039         * @return file output.
040         * @throws FileNotFoundException if file not found.
041         */
042        @SuppressWarnings("resource")
043        @LogConfigurable(prefix = LogProperties.OUTPUT_PREFIX)
044        public static FileOutput of(@LogConfigurable.KeyParameter String name, URI uri, String fileName,
045                        @Nullable Boolean append, @Nullable Boolean prudent) throws FileNotFoundException {
046                prudent = prudent == null ? false : prudent;
047                File file = new File(fileName);
048                createMissingParentDirectories(file);
049                FileOutputStream stream = new FileOutputStream(file, append);
050                if (prudent) {
051                        return new FileChannelOutput(uri, stream.getChannel());
052                }
053                return new FileOutputStreamOutput(uri, stream);
054        }
055
056        /**
057         * Creates the parent directories of a file. If parent directories not specified in
058         * file's path, then nothing is done and this returns gracefully.
059         * @param file file whose parent directories (if any) should be created
060         * @return {@code true} if either no parents were specified, or if all parent
061         * directories were created successfully; {@code false} otherwise
062         */
063        private static boolean createMissingParentDirectories(File file) {
064                File parent = file.getParentFile();
065                if (parent == null) {
066                        // Parent directory not specified, therefore it's a request to
067                        // create nothing. Done! ;)
068                        return true;
069                }
070
071                // File.mkdirs() creates the parent directories only if they don't
072                // already exist; and it's okay if they do.
073                parent.mkdirs();
074                return parent.exists();
075        }
076
077}
078
079class FileOutputStreamOutput extends LogOutput.AbstractOutputStreamOutput implements FileOutput {
080
081        protected FileOutputStreamOutput(URI uri, OutputStream outputStream) {
082                super(uri, outputStream);
083        }
084
085}
086
087class FileChannelOutput implements FileOutput {
088
089        protected final URI uri;
090
091        protected final FileChannel channel;
092
093        public FileChannelOutput(URI uri, FileChannel channel) {
094                super();
095                this.uri = uri;
096                this.channel = channel;
097        }
098
099        @Override
100        public URI uri() throws UnsupportedOperationException {
101                return uri;
102        }
103
104        @Override
105        public void write(LogEvent event, byte[] bytes, int off, int len, ContentType contentType) {
106                write(event, ByteBuffer.wrap(bytes, off, len), contentType);
107        }
108
109        @Override
110        public void write(LogEvent event, ByteBuffer buffer, ContentType contentType) {
111                try {
112
113                        // Clear any current interrupt (see LOGBACK-875)
114                        boolean interrupted = Thread.interrupted();
115
116                        FileLock fileLock = null;
117                        try {
118                                fileLock = channel.lock();
119                                long position = channel.position();
120                                long size = channel.size();
121                                if (size != position) {
122                                        channel.position(size);
123                                }
124                                channel.write(buffer);
125
126                        }
127                        catch (IOException e) {
128                                MetaLog.error(FileChannelOutput.class, e);
129                        }
130                        finally {
131                                if (fileLock != null && fileLock.isValid()) {
132                                        fileLock.release();
133                                }
134                                if (interrupted) {
135                                        Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
136                                }
137                        }
138                }
139                catch (IOException e) {
140                        throw new UncheckedIOException(e);
141                }
142        }
143
144        @Override
145        public void close() {
146                try {
147                        channel.close();
148                }
149                catch (IOException e) {
150                        throw new UncheckedIOException(e);
151                }
152        }
153
154        @Override
155        public void flush() {
156                try {
157                        channel.force(false);
158                }
159                catch (IOException e) {
160                        throw new UncheckedIOException(e);
161                }
162        }
163
164        @Override
165        public WriteMethod writeMethod() {
166                return WriteMethod.BYTE_BUFFER;
167        }
168
169}
